summary: The document is a journal entry from the Office of Legislative Counsel dated 1 May 1978, detailing various liaison activities with the House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence and other entities. It discusses setting up meetings on topics like terrorism and the Fourth International, the possibility of open and closed sessions on terrorism, discussions on codeword cover sheets and file destruction, and the provision of intelligence reports.
key_findings: A meeting was arranged to discuss terrorism and the Fourth International with House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence staff.
Concerns were raised about the difficulties of an open session on terrorism for the CIA, suggesting a compromise of an open statement followed by a closed session.
Discussions were held regarding the provision of codeword cover sheets and the inclusion of the Committee in the USG number control system.
The House recess schedule was communicated, detailing breaks in July and August.
The CIA was advised against the destruction of files, particularly CI files on U.S. citizens, following strong urging from the House Select Committee on Assassinations.
Intelligence reports requested by GAO's International Division were to be made available, with one possible exception.
keywords: House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence
